title: How to Start a Gluten Free Diet
steps: Find gluten-free replacements.
Read the labels.
Have separate gluten-free kitchen appliances.
Ask questions at restaurants.
Try gluten-free recipes at home.
Be conscious of cross-contamination.

title: How to Eat Grain Free
steps: Look up the menu before you go.
Consider calling ahead to ask about grain-free options.
Ask for a gluten-free menu.
Be patient with your server when asking questions.

title: How to Add More Raw Foods to Your Diet
steps: Figure out which kinds of food can be eaten raw.
Make sure you know where to get this food.
Go through your list.
Buy those things or plant them on your backyard.
Acquire the habit of buying smaller quantities of perishable food and shopping more often.
Look closely at your eating habits and think how much you want to change and where do you want to add more raw.
Plan.

title: How to Succeed on the Raw Food Diet
steps: Research the science of the raw food diet.
Understand which foods are acceptable and why.
Plan out your meals ahead of time.
Eliminate unacceptable foods from the home.
Use combinations of flavors to add variety to your meals.
Secure the support of family members and friends.
Start a journal to monitor your success.

title: How to Avoid Gluten
steps: Find the gluten-free aisle at your grocery store.
Shop at a health food store.
Use gluten-free flour in your favorite recipes.
Purchase a gluten-free cookbook.
Inquire about gluten-free options before attending a party.
Ask a restaurant server about gluten-free options.
Scout out gluten-free restaurants or bakeries in your area.

title: How to Know if a Gluten‐Free Diet Is Right for You
steps: Keep a food journal.
Learn which grains contain gluten.
Understand what types of food contain gluten.
Plan to supplement gluten with healthy alternatives.
Consider other diets if you’re trying to lose weight.
Avoid a gluten-free diet if you’re at risk for vitamin deficiency.

title: How to Know What Flour to Use for Gluten Free Baking
steps: Review gluten-free baking websites.
Download a list of gluten-free flour manufacturers.

title: How to Prepare Low Sodium Lunches
steps: Read the nutrition label.
Pay attention to serving size.
Identify low sodium labels.
Aim for fresh, frozen, or dried foods.
Find dairy products.
Avoid processed foods.

title: How to Make Brownies
steps: Make chocolate brownies.
Make cream-covered brownies.
Make S'more brownies.
Make gluten free brownies.
Make peppermint brownies.

title: How to Remove Gluten from Your Diet
steps: Remove wheat from your kitchen: start with bread, pasta and pizzas as these items contain a lot of wheat, which is really bad for people on a gluten free diet.
Remove items containing barley and other cereals like oats and barley as they also contain gluten.
Regarding alcohol, you need to stop drinking beer (you can now find gluten-free beer though) and whiskey.
Start reading the labels on every item you are going to buy.
Nearly all supermarkets sell gluten-free food: bread, pizzas, biscuits, pastas...
Be careful when you go out as you don't know what ingredients are used in their recipes.
Start cooking fresh food!.

title: How to Be Gluten Free and Vegan
steps: Check for the label "vegan.".
Look for labels like "gluten-free.".
Look for the allergen list.
Read the ingredient list for non-vegan ingredients.
Check the ingredients list for wheat.
Look out for food starch.
Check for signs of cross-contamination with gluten.
